prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with rounded corners. The first part is a rectangular prism with dimensions of 0.75 units in length, 0.75 units in width, and 0.375 units in height. The rounded corners will be added through the sketching process. 1. Create a new coordinate system with no rotation or translation. 2. Begin a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 3. Draw a square with sides of 0.75 units using four lines (line_1, line_2, line_3, line_4) joined end-to-end to form a loop (loop_1) on the X-Y plane. 4. Close the loop to form a complete square. 5. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. 6. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the Euler angles and translation vector provided in the JSON. 7. Extrude the 2D sketch by a depth of 0.375 units towards the normal. 8. Perform a 'Join' operation to add this new part to the previous one. Part 2: Construct a duplicate of Part 1 with a new body operation. The second part is an identical copy of Part 1, but it's created with a new body operation. 1. Create a new coordinate system with no rotation or translation. 2. Begin a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 3. Draw a square with sides of 0.75 units using four lines (line_1, line_2, line_3, line_4) joined end-to-end to form a loop (loop_1) on the X-Y plane. 4. Close the loop to form a complete square. 5. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. 6. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the Euler angles and translation vector provided in the JSON. 7. Extrude the 2D sketch by a depth of 0.375 units towards the normal. 8. Perform a 'New Body' operation to create a new solid body for this part. These instructions generate two identical three-dimensional rectangular prisms with rounded corners. By following the instructions for each part, a junior CAD designer can replicate the intended shapes accurately. Remember, the provided information should be used as-is without making any assumptions.</description>
